concise_definition: v. 终止, 解雇, 结束

definitions.explanation_en: To bring something to an end, especially formally or officially, such as a contract, process, or relationship.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指正式或官方地使某事物结束，如合同、流程或关系。
definitions.example_en: The company terminated the contract due to repeated breaches of terms.
definitions.example_cn: 由于多次违反条款，公司终止了该合同。

definitions.explanation_en: To dismiss someone from a job, often abruptly or for cause, such as misconduct or poor performance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指解雇某人，通常为突然或因不当行为、表现不佳等原因。
definitions.example_en: He was terminated from his position after failing to meet quarterly targets.
definitions.example_cn: 他因未能完成季度目标而被解雇。

definitions.explanation_en: To end at a point or limit, often used in technical or spatial contexts to describe the end of a line, road, or sequence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在某一点或界限处结束，常用于技术或空间语境，描述线条、道路或序列的终点。
definitions.example_en: The hiking trail terminates at the edge of the cliff.
definitions.example_cn: 这条徒步小径在悬崖边缘终止。

comparison.analysis: “Fire” (解雇) 是口语化表达，常用于非正式场合，语气更直接、情绪化，通常带有负面色彩。而 “terminate” 更正式、中性，常用于法律或人力资源文件中，强调程序性而非情感性。
“End” (结束) 是最通用的词，适用于任何类型的终止，不带正式或强制的含义。而 “terminate” 暗示一种有意识的、通常是权威性的决定，常用于制度性或结构性的终结，如合同、服务或雇佣关系。
“Discharge” (解除职务) 常用于军事或医疗语境，指正式解除某人的职责或义务，有时带有荣誉性（如军人退役）。而 “terminate” 更广泛用于商业和行政语境，且不隐含荣誉或补偿，更侧重于关系的强制性终结。
